abstract: Catholic Charities Archdiocese of New York, one of seven agencies supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund, helps Drissa Cisse and his wife Aminata Sylla of Harlem buy furniture for their apartment.
lead_paragraph: Fleeing Ivory Coast death squads, Drissa Cisse won asylum and was joined in New York by his wife, Aminata Sylla, who said they and their four children “restarted life at zero.”

headline.main: Muslim Refugee and His Family Find a Haven in Harlem
headline.print_headline: New Fight for Refugee: Restarting ‘Life at Zero’

snippet: Fleeing Ivory Coast death squads, Drissa Cisse won asylum and was joined in New York by his wife, Aminata Sylla, who said they and their four children “restarted life at zero.”
